articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces blew up homes and besieged schools and shelters for displaced people as they deepened their operations in Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip.
articles.title: Israeli forces storm shelters, detain men, as north Gaza raid deepens

articles.author: Amina Ismail, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: With U.S. elections approaching, officials, diplomats and other sources in the region say Israel is seeking to shield its borders and ensure its rivals cannot regroup.
articles.title: Israel intensifies offensive in Gaza, Lebanon after Hamas leader's death

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Alexander Tanas
articles.description: The tight finish is far from the resounding endorsement of the pro-EU path that Sandu has pursued over four years at the helm of the small ex-Soviet republic tugged between Russia and the West.
articles.title: Moldova's EU referendum goes to wire; Sandu decries vote meddling

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's foreign ministry has summoned the Russian ambassador in Seoul in protest over what it has said is the dispatch of North Korean troops to the country for deployment in Ukraine, the Yonhap news agency reported on Monday.
articles.title: Russian ambassador in Seoul summoned over N.Korea troop deployment, Yonhap reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin visited Ukraine on Monday, in a show of U.S. support for Kyiv just two weeks ahead of a U.S. presidential election that is casting uncertainty over the future of Western support.
articles.title: As US election looms, Pentagon chief visits Ukraine in show of support

articles.author: Lewis Jackson
articles.description: Among the thousand plus well-wishers gathered to greet King Charles and Queen Camilla at the Australian War Memorial in Canberra on Monday was Hephner, a nine-year old alpaca in a suit with a crown perched atop his fluffy white head.
articles.title: King Charles greets happy crowds, an angry MP and an alpaca on visit to Canberra

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former president Donald Trump remain in a tight contest across seven battleground states with just two weeks until the November U.S. presidential election, a Washington Post/Schar School poll showed on Monday.
articles.title: Harris, Trump in dead heat across swing states in Washington Post poll

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Initial reports indicate a car explosion in the Mazzeh area of Damascus on Monday, Syrian state media said, following earlier reports of a blast heard in the vicinity.
articles.title: Explosion in Damascus' Mazzeh area appears to be from car, state media says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva was doing "super well" on Monday after he suffered a head injury at home over the weekend that caused a minor brain hemorrhage, Institutional Relations Minister Alexandre Padilha told reporters.
articles.title: Brazil's Lula 'well' after head injury, minister says

articles.author: Daren Butler
articles.description: Gulen's movement - known as "Hizmet" which means "service" in Turkish - seeks to spread a moderate brand of Islam that promotes Western-style education, free markets and interfaith communication.
articles.title: Gulen, the powerful cleric accused of orchestrating a Turkish coup, dies
